clishell

Class ConsoleStack<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • clishell.ConsoleStack<T>

  • public class ConsoleStack<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages "stack" of "console I/O objects of type T". Currently, accepts either java.io.PrintWriter or java.io.InputStream objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConsoleStack() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getConsole() 
      void setConsole(T newConsole) 
      void unsetConsole(T oldConsole)
      Removes specified console object from stack, resulting in a new "current console object of type T" if the specified object is at the head of the stack

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleStack

        public ConsoleStack()

    • Method Detail

      • getConsole

        public T getConsole()
        Returns:
        I/O object of type T in current use by CliRunner will return null if stack is empty

      • setConsole

        public void setConsole(T newConsole)
        Parameters:
        newConsole - object to push onto the "stack" of console objects of type T, and to begin using as the active object
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if newConsole is null, or IllegalArgumentException if newConsole is an instance of an unsupported class

      • unsetConsole

        public void unsetConsole(T oldConsole)
                  throws CliRunnerException
        Removes specified console object from stack, resulting in a new "current console object of type T" if the specified object is at the head of the stack
        Parameters:
        oldConsole - old console object, previously set using setConsole()
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - thrown if attempt to pop last console object, or could not find specified console object in stack
